title: CHEAP: This DJI Mavic Air drone kit is $150 off — fly my pretties, fly!
text:
Drones are badass, right? Something that would’ve been science fiction a decade ago is now generally affordable.

You know, like the DJI Mavic Air. This drone lets mere mortals have access to what’s basically professional cinematography equipment. And while this classy piece of tech usually doesn’t come cheap, hold onto your hats, because this DJI Mavic Air Kit is discounted by almost $150 — making it a sweet $750.

So, what is the DJI Mavic Air? Well, it’s a foldable drone with a 4K camera. It’s the lovechild of the highly successful Mavic Pro and consumer friendly Spark. The result? A drone that’s both easy to use, but stuffed with professional features.

The camera capabilities of the Mavic Air really are something. It has a 3-axis Gimbal Camera with HDR capability, meaning you’re gonna get steady shots, even in subpar conditions. In addition to this, the DJI Mavic Air can create 32MP panoramas within 8 seconds. And what are the use of those? Well, you can whack on the pair of goggles included in the kit and have a full on immersive experience.

Now, what else do you get in the kit? Well, a whole load of things, including:

A fancy carry case

A 64GB microSD card

A controller

Charging cables

Spare rotors

Here’s a photo with it all on:

LOOK AT ALL THAT SWEET SHIT.

So, more about the drone. Looking to expand into the world of videography? The DJI Mavic Air has your back. As aforementioned, it can record in 4K, but does so with a rate of 30 frames per second. It also uses HDR photos, to ensure the snaps you take are of the highest quality.

The DJI Mavic Air also has 8GB of internal storage. While this isn’t massive, there’s a slot for some expandable storage (which, as we’ve mentioned above, this kit comes with).

The drones controller also links to your smartphone, providing you with a live, birds-eye view of its surroundings. If all of this isn’t reason enough to take the plunge into the growing world of drone cinematography, the DJI Mavic Air kit also includes 1 year’s extended warranty. So really, what’s stopping you taking your first airborne photography excursion?

Pick up the DJI Mavic Air for $750 here, while stocks last.
